Hello partner, welcome to Lenovo!



My name is Sharlene Baltodano, it is a pleasure to contact you and begin a relationship, that I hope, will help you to grow your business alongside Lenovo.



I am part of the Channel Partner Onboarding team, and I will be your Rep while you may need me. I am excited to talk with you about the benefits of being a Lenovo Partner, and let you know information that will help you, making your business life easier.



To begin the onboarding process, I’d appreciate if you answer this email letting me know the means of communication by which you prefer to receive your onboarding:



-Phone call

-Teams meeting



Please note that part of the onboarding includes showing you how to navigate the Lenovo Partner Hub, so if you choose to complete the process via phone call the portal navigation guide will be sent to you via email, whereas, if you choose to complete the process via meeting the guide will be given to you live in a 30min meeting.



**Phone calls and meetings must be scheduled, please share youravailability and time zone and the method of communication by which you would like to receive your onboarding.**

Don’t hesitate on contacting me for any doubt that may appear. It is my pleasure to help.



Disclaimer: if you’re not the correct person I need to talk, please forward this email to him/her to be onboarded.



Best Regards,





**Sharlene Baltodano**
Channel Partner Onboarding Rep.
Lenovo NA.

Hi,



We are currently experiencing an issue in which we have no network access when logged in with Windows Hello (PIN, Fingerprint, Face ID).  This occurs across all office locations and affects ability to access network drives and a couple of locally hosted applications.  If we login with password, all works OK.  As a workaround, locking screen and unlocking with password seems to resolve the issue without having to reboot.



Additionally, when screen is locked and attempting to unlock screen with Windows Hello, a message is displayed that your credentials could not be verified.



Any ideas?



Thanks,



Tommy



**Tommy Kaelin**
Service Desk Manager
Phone: 502.882.4460
Fax: 502.749.1930

events.html_body:
Hi,

 

We are currently experiencing an issue in which we have no network access when logged in with Windows Hello (PIN, Fingerprint, Face ID).  This occurs across all office locations and affects ability to access network drives and a couple of locally hosted applications.  If we login with password, all works OK.  As a workaround, locking screen and unlocking with password seems to resolve the issue without having to reboot.

 

Additionally, when screen is locked and attempting to unlock screen with Windows Hello, a message is displayed that your credentials could not be verified.

 

Any ideas?

 

Thanks,

 

Tommy

 

Tommy Kaelin
Service Desk Manager
Phone: 502.882.4460
Fax: 502.749.1930

events.body:
William,



Is this an known issue that Microsoft is working on? We are not alone in this case?



Besides all our users are having this issue, the more specific symptoms are:

Search not working on emails that have attachments.

Search not working only for emails that was sent/received after 6/2.2023 and those emails had attachment.



I would like your help to pass these specific symptoms to Microsoft, since it is not simply search not working, but it is some unique broken part regarding emails with attachment, and with a timeline cut off date since around 6/2.



I don’t want to see Search is addressed but our issue of attachment is not addressed.



Thank you

The project 1 plan is the must basic you can get from the 3 of them and you will not have most of the features that the tool offers, It also has a web version only. Hi,



We are developing an API call that will create a folder in OneDrive when a new opportunity is created in Salesforce.  I have a pair of Salesforce developers working on it and we cannot get past the error noted below.  Can you assist?



Thank you,

Terry





Terry Cole

I.T. Manager



BLUEWATER

30303 Beck Rd • Wixom, MI • 48393

O: 800-344-6575  X: 479  M: 248-568-0537
tcole@bluewatertech.com • bluewatertech.com



As discovered last week, we are receiving an error message when authorizing Microsoft Azure from Salesforce.


"invalid_request AADSTS50194: Application '63c46e96-167f-4017-9e78-d8d99ddb4bc8' (SalesforceAutomatedFolderCreationInOneDrive) is not configured as a multi-tenant application. Usage of the /common endpoint is not supported for such applications created after '10/15/2018'. Use a tenant-specific endpoint or configure the application to be multi-tenant."



The core of the issue is the following combination:

- we are receiving an error message, prompting us not to use the /common endpoint or to instead change the app registration to be multi-tenant
- we are not using the /common endpoint - we use the tenant id as advised:  https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenant-id}/oauth2/v2.0/authorize
- we desire the app registration to be single-tenant, as this is an internal application

After quite a bit of investigation, unfortunately, we have not come across any concrete resolutions apart from converting the application to a multi-tenant setup.

Usage of the /common endpoint is not supported for such applications created after '10/15/2018'. Use a tenant-specific endpoint or configure the application to be multi-tenant."

The core of the issue is the following combination:
  • we are receiving an error message, prompting us not to use the /common endpoint or to instead change the app registration to be multi-tenant
  • we are not using the /common endpoint - we use the tenant id as advised:  https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenant-id}/oauth2/v2.0/authorize

After quite a bit of investigation, unfortunately, we have not come across any concrete resolutions apart from converting the application to a multi-tenant setup.
events.plain_body:
Hi, 
 


 
 
We are developing an API call that will create a folder in OneDrive when a new opportunity is created in Salesforce.  I have a pair of Salesforce developers working on it and we cannot get past the error noted below.  Can you assist? 
 


 
 
Thank you, 
 
Terry 
 


 
 
 


 
 
 
 
Terry Cole 

 
 
I.T. Manager 
 
 
BLUEWATER 
 
30303 Beck Rd • Wixom, MI • 48393 
 
O: 800-344-6575  X: 479 
 M: 248-568-0537

tcole@bluewatertech.com • bluewatertech.com 
 
 
 
 


 
 
As
 discovered last week, we are receiving an error message when authorizing Microsoft Azure from Salesforce.
 


 
 
"invalid_request AADSTS50194: Application '63c46e96-167f-4017-9e78-d8d99ddb4bc8' (SalesforceAutomatedFolderCreationInOneDrive) is not configured as a multi-tenant application. Usage of the /common endpoint is not supported for such applications created after
 '10/15/2018'. Use a tenant-specific endpoint or configure the application to be multi-tenant."

 
 


 
 
The core of the issue is the following combination: 
 
 
 we are receiving an error message, prompting us not to use the /common endpoint or to instead change the app registration to be multi-tenant  we are not using the /common endpoint - we use the tenant id as advised:  https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenant-id}/oauth2/v2.0/authorize

  we desire the app registration to be single-tenant, as this is an internal application  
 
After quite a bit of investigation, unfortunately, we have not come across any concrete resolutions apart from converting the application to a multi-tenant setup.

events.body:
Hello Terry!

We were reviewing this ticket with my team and we found two possible solutions:

1. Configure the application as multi-tenant
2. Use a tenant-specific endpoint

Knowing that you may not want to have this as a multi-tenant app you could try to configure a tenant-specific endpoint: A tenant-specific endpoint is specific to a particular organization or tenant. To do this, you will need to modify your API call to use the endpoint that corresponds to the organization where the Salesforce and OneDrive integration is taking place. You can obtain the tenant-specific endpoint from the Azure Active Directory (AAD) portal or the OneDrive API documentation.

To obtain the tenant-specific endpoint from the Azure Active Directory (AAD) portal, you can follow these steps:


1. Sign in to the Azure portal using your Azure AD administrator account.
2. Navigate to the "Azure Active Directory" section.
3. In the left-hand menu, select "App registrations" where your application is registered.
4. Locate and select your application from the list.
5. On the application overview page, you should find the "Endpoints" section. Look for the "Federation Metadata Document" URL or the "OpenID Connect metadata document" URL. Both of these URLs should contain the tenant-specific endpoint.

 ![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/gma3Bre7p4Bg298HCjD0TowiC/?name=image.png)

The URL will have the following format: "https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenant-id}/". The {tenant-id} part represents the specific organization's Azure AD tenant.

events.subject: Check in - ticket (#{{ticket.id}})
events.body:
Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}

I hope all is well! I just wanted to check in and see if you have been able to make any progress with the request in the ticket: (#{{ticket.id}}) 

To maintain consistent service levels for all our clients, we close tickets after seven business days when we await an answer. 

If you want live support from our support team, please call us at 844-944-6934 or reply to this email, and we will contact you.

![Welcome to the team!](https://s3.amazonaws.com/partner-apps-production/EmailStaticImg/partner-logo.png)

Dear Edwin
Welcome to the Lenovo Partner Hub - You are now approved and registered on Lenovo Partner Hub and have full access to the Lenovo Partner Portal.

During the registration process, you accepted the terms and conditions of the Lenovo Partner Network Agreement and the associated terms governing your participation in the Lenovo Special Bid process (the "Agreement"). The Agreement applies to both Lenovo personal computer and smart devices (“PCSD”) and Lenovo data center products (being server and storage products) (“ISG Products”). PC Products and ISG Products are sold by different Lenovo entities.


 Ready to take a look around the portal?

 Here are your portal login details:

 Account: D4US, LLC

 Username: support@myd4.com

Create your Password Now >>

You’ve been assigned the role of Administrator (Admin) and will have the ability to:

- Oversee company level performance, rebates and contracts
- Provide general support for sales and marketing roles
- Manages system access and assign portal roles (Personas) within organization following agreed rules with Lenovo
  - Sales
  - Sales Manager
  - Marketing
  - Admin
- Manage your company’s profile and locations.
- Add / manage the employee records for your company

If you are not the person within your company responsible for the above mentioned on a day-to-day basis, please ensure to assign the ADMIN role to the person who is.

We’re ready to support you, and we’re looking forward to a successful relationship.


**Regards,**

_Lenovo Partner Hub team_

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}

I hope all is well! I just wanted to check in and see if you have been able to make any progress with the request in the ticket: (#{{ticket.id}}) 

To maintain consistent service levels for all our clients, we close tickets after seven business days when we await an answer. 

If you want live support from our support team, please call us at 844-944-6934 or reply to this email, and we will contact you.

Good afternoon,



I have two devices that are not currently registered in Windows Autopilot, and I would like to request your assistance in getting them registered so we can remotely manage them.



**Description**

**Service Tag**

**Location**

Dell Precision Mobile Workstation 7710 laptop

JZB2PF2

Fairfax, VA

HPNKHT2

Burlington, MA

Would you be able to schedule a time between now and close of business on Friday to guide us through the process? I am available any time except from 1300-1400 Eastern on Thursday.



Thank you,

Vince

events.body:
Vince,

So this "Gemin" device is the one that you cannot log in with any credentials?

I think this was an azure ad join device but it was removed from the autopilot devices so there is no way to authenticate to Azure. If this device was connected to a domain we may need to connect it inside Gemini's Local Network.

The best we could try is to do a clean install of the device since I think this will be a azure ad join correct?
events.html_body:
Vince,
 
So this "Gemin" device is the one that you cannot log in with any credentials?
 
I think this was an azure ad join device but it was removed from the autopilot devices so there is no way to authenticate to Azure. If this device was connected to a domain we may need to connect it inside Gemini's Local Network.  
 
The best we could try is to do a clean install of the device since I think this will be a azure ad join correct?

Ticket Update Zendesk

events.body: {"updaterId":"{{current_user.id}}","assignee":"{{ticket.assignee.id}}","priority":"{{ticket.priority}}","ticketId":"{{ticket.id}}","updatedAt":"{{ticket.updated_at_with_timestamp}}","commentCount":"{{ticket.comments.size}}","status":"{{ticket.status}}"}

system.client: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/113.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

events.body:
Vince,

We usually create a local account to take the hash and then run Sysprep, after that, we get the autopilot profile deployed to the computer so the device became fully managed as Azure AD join device.

In this case, when we reset the computer, the system is not letting us create a local account to run the Sysprep, instead, it lets us access using an Office 365 account to become a registered device. This means that the device cannot be assigned to another user. We could try to get the hash from that device but it may take longer to recognize the device. Please let me know if you would like us to proceed with that.

Regards

Camilo Zetino
events.html_body:
Vince,
 
We usually create a local account to take the hash and then run Sysprep, after that, we get the autopilot profile deployed to the computer so the device became fully managed as Azure AD join device.
 
In this case, when we reset the computer, the system is not letting us create a local account to run the Sysprep, instead, it lets us access using an Office 365 account to become a registered device. This means that the device cannot be assigned to another user. We could try to get the hash from that device but it may take longer to recognize the device. Please let me know if you would like us to proceed with that.
 
Regards
 
Camilo Zetino

events.body:
Vince,

Yes, the best would be to format the drive, reinstall Windows and have a local account to run Sysprep (OOBE) so we do not have any other policy or OS feature causing a problem. And both devices will be fully managed by Intune using the autopilot profile.

I think there is no need at the moment for a call with Dell.

Talk to you on Monday!
Happy Weekend!

Camilo
events.html_body:
Vince,
 
Yes, the best would be to format the drive, reinstall Windows and have a local account to run Sysprep (OOBE) so we do not have any other policy or OS feature causing a problem. And both devices will be fully managed by Intune using the autopilot profile.
 
I think there is no need at the moment for a call with Dell. 
 
Talk to you on Monday!
Happy Weekend!
 
Camilo

Hello Vince,

Happy Monday!

Good News for today, I was reviewing the device (JZB2PF2-Fairfax, VA) and it got registered in the portal, it means that now we can run an **AutopilotReset if we want to have it clean** and the device can be assigned to a user. But in order to sign in with another username, we need to run AutoPilot Reset. If the device is already in use, we can postpone it until we reassign the device but let me know if this is good for you.

 ![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/bP4ZnLuuYm6phrz7Lmow1SFtf/?name=image.png)

Regards
events.html_body:
Hello Vince,
 
Happy Monday!
 
Good News for today, I was reviewing the device (JZB2PF2-Fairfax, VA) and it got registered in the portal, it means that now we can run an AutopilotReset if we want to have it clean and the device can be assigned to a user. But in order to sign in with another username, we need to run AutoPilot Reset. If the device is already in use, we can postpone it until we reassign the device but let me know if this is good for you. 
 

 
Regards

events.body:
Hi Camilo,



Happy Monday to you! I hope you had a great weekend. Thank you for the update. I checked the Microsoft Intune admin center found the device. We do not have anyone to assign it to at this time (we assigned a different laptop to our new employee), but when we do, I will initiate an Autopilot Reset.



With regard to the other device you worked on under this ticket, Dell Vostro 5581 laptop (Service Tag: HPNKHT2 / Device Name: DESKTOP-AKRODMK)), it appears in the Microsoft Intune admin center under**Windows enrollment > Devices > Windows Autopilot devices**, but it does not appear under**Windows devices**. I decided to see if I could add it to the Azure group **MDATP_Burlington**, and when I searched on the device name, I found the following:



![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/HxzqWd2sUeYMAYim2SyeWIPhN/?name=image001.png)



So, I am not sure what the status of this device is. Can you check and let me know?



Thank you very much, Camilo,

Vince

Vince,

We were checking the device and there are many local profiles but we wonder if you could help us with the access to the VMACONI local account, we just want to be able to run a sysprep, or if you can help us with it that would be great. We are having difficulties trying to do sysprep with the account we are signed in already and we want to try a different option.



## How to Sysprep Windows 10 step by step
1. Press **Windows** logo **key + R** at the same time. Select **Type in Sysprep** on the search field.
2. Type the following window double-click Sysprep and let's leave it like the image bellow.

 ![image](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/Iify5WZfkqynibZxN7NFUNWTt/?name=inlineImage.jpeg)


Please let us know.

We are having difficulties trying to do sysprep with the account we are signed in already and we want to try a different option.
 
 

How to Sysprep Windows 10 step by step

1. Press Windows logo key + R at the same time. Select Type in Sysprep on the search field.
2. Type the following window double-click Sysprep and let's leave it like the image bellow.
 

 
 
Please let us know.

events.body:
Good Morning Vince,

That is good to hear!

For the new laptops, we could start by creating a local account, not joining them to the domain, performing all updates, and then I can take the hash out of them. Once we upload the files, we could run OOBE.

Let me know if you would like to start making updates to the devices. I'm willing to help you.

Regards

Camilo
events.html_body:
Good Morning Vince,
 
That is good to hear!
 
For the new laptops, we could start by creating a local account, not joining them to the domain, performing all updates, and then I can take the hash out of them. Once we upload the files, we could run OOBE. 
 
Let me know if you would like to start making updates to the devices. I'm willing to help you.
 
Regards
 
Camilo

events.body:
Hi Camilo,



I have the Service Tag numbers for the remaining two computers (5JRJ6X3, and 7JRJ6X3), and I have confirmed that they are alsolisted in the Microsoft Intune admin center under Devices | Overview  > Windows | Windows enrollment > Windows Autopilot devices.



I have assigned the computer with Service Tag 7KRJ6X3 to Ryan Burgess (rburgess@gemini-ind.com) in Windows Enrollment, but I did not enter a Device name because I don’t know whether there is a convention or standard for doing so.  All of the other Azure AD joined computers have device named that start with “DESKTOP-“ (even the laptops), but the remaining characters seem to be random.



By the way, our purchase includes Dell Remote PC Setup Assistance. I received an email from the Project Coordinator – Installation Services, which stated:



Remote PC Setup Assistance allows us to remotely assist with the installation and connectivity of your new computer. We can also help you set up your printer and migrate your data and personal settings from your old computer to your new one if needed.



If you have any software that you would like installed on the new computer, we can help with that, too. We’ll need to have a quick conversation to verify some information so that I can give you an estimate of how long the migration will take.



However, it’s by appointment and you have to schedule three days in advance, so that may not be convenient.



I await your recommendations regarding how to proceed. I would like to get Ryan’s computer set up by early tomorrow if possible.



Thanks,

Vince

events.body: {"updaterId":"{{current_user.id}}","assignee":"{{ticket.assignee.id}}","priority":"{{ticket.priority}}","ticketId":"{{ticket.id}}","updatedAt":"{{ticket.updated_at_with_timestamp}}","commentCount":"{{ticket.comments.size}}","status":"{{ticket.status}}"}

system.client: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/113.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

events.body:
Good morning Vince,

Thanks for letting me know that. In that case, that changes a bit.

The steps that we need to follow for Azure AD joined devices are:

1. We create a local admin account, if the device is already with one admin account, we can use that to take the hash. If the computer has been cleaned recently and it shows like the picture above, click "Domain join instead" and create a local admin account with a simple username and password, since this will be only to update the W10 pro to the latest version, then we'll need to run OOBE. Please do not add this device to the Gemini domain.

Note: Before we run OOBE, we need to add the devices to the groups required which means Autopilot_AzurePC or the AutoPilot_Cloud_Devices. Users can be assigned or not to the devices.
 ![How To Setup Windows 10 Without a Microsoft Account](https://helpdeskgeek.com/wp-content/pictures/2020/06/setup-windows-10-microsoft-account-pro-domain-join.png)
Then, we provide a name to the device and a password:
 ![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/QvEorbp0NmwrllCvmYbrBYHow/?name=image.png)


When the OOBE is completed, users can sign in using their O365 accounts.

I can add the devices to the group in Intune, do you know if they have admin accounts and if the OS is up to date?
events.html_body:
Good morning Vince,
 
Thanks for letting me know that. In that case, that changes a bit.
 
The steps that we need to follow for Azure AD joined devices are:
  1. We create a local admin account, if the device is already with one admin account, we can use that to take the hash. If the computer has been cleaned recently and it shows like the picture above, click "Domain join instead" and create a local admin account with a simple username and password, since this will be only to update the W10 pro to the latest version, then we'll need to run OOBE. Please do not add this device to the Gemini domain.
 
Note: Before we run OOBE, we need to add the devices to the groups required which means Autopilot_AzurePC or the AutoPilot_Cloud_Devices. Users can be assigned or not to the devices. 

Then, we provide a name to the device and a password:

 
 
When the OOBE is completed, users can sign in using their O365 accounts.
 
I can add the devices to the group in Intune, do you know if they have admin accounts and if the OS is up to date?

events.html_body:
Good morning, Camilo,

 

I hope you had a great weekend. Thanks for the explanation. I have just one more question: what is the best way to prepare a computer for a new user. I usually perform the following steps in the Intune admin center:

 

Devices > Windows > Windows enrollment > Windows Autopilot devices > Assign user

 

Devices > Windows > Windows devices > Overview > Autopilot Reset

 

Devices > Windows > Windows devices > Properties > Change primary user

 

Please let me know if I should do anything else, or not do any of these steps.

 

One other question. One of the machines that we enrolled in Intune under this ticket is the following laptop:

 

Device model:   Dell Vostro 5581

Device name:     HYB-Zhscn9BwxAp

Serial number:  HPNKHT2

 

When I go to Devices > Windows > Windows devices > Overview, Autopilot Reset is grayed out. What does that mean?

events.body: {"updaterId":"{{current_user.id}}","assignee":"{{ticket.assignee.id}}","priority":"{{ticket.priority}}","ticketId":"{{ticket.id}}","updatedAt":"{{ticket.updated_at_with_timestamp}}","commentCount":"{{ticket.comments.size}}","status":"{{ticket.status}}"}

system.client: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/113.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

events.body:
Hello Vince,

I had an amazing weekend, thank you. I hope you had also a great one!


1. We normally do the following steps as you mentioned:

              Devices > Windows > Windows enrollment > Windows Autopilot devices > Assign user

              Devices > Windows > Windows devices > Overview > Autopilot Reset

      The third step can be skipped but this takes time to refresh automatically in the overview pane from the device selected:

               Devices > Windows > Windows devices > Properties > Change primary user


2. The grayed-out means this device cannot be sysprep because it's in the hybrid profile. They were joined by the Group Policy located in the DC to Azure AD. That is why is showing that way.

Let me know if you need further assistance.

Camilo
events.html_body:
Hello Vince,
 
I had an amazing weekend, thank you. I hope you had also a great one!
 
  1. We normally do the following steps as you mentioned: 
 
              Devices > Windows > Windows enrollment > Windows Autopilot devices > Assign user
 
              Devices > Windows > Windows devices > Overview > Autopilot Reset
 
      The third step can be skipped but this takes time to refresh automatically in the overview pane from the device selected: 
 
               Devices > Windows > Windows devices > Properties > Change primary user
 
 
2. The grayed-out means this device cannot be sysprep because it's in the hybrid profile. They were joined by the Group Policy located in the DC to Azure AD. That is why is showing that way.
 
Let me know if you need further assistance.
 
Camilo

Team,



The OKTA session has routinely updated licensing that has been configured in the Office portal.  We are preparing to test Intune device management and with that need to have various license types as options from within OKTA to associate with the accounts.



1. How can we isolate an account in a manner that is no longer governed by OKTA?  I am unable to create a service account against lcsfin.com (only option we have is <account name>@lcsfin.onmicrosoft.com which will not work for what we need it to do.  I need an account created (onboarding@lcsfin.com) that has necessary licensing and appropriate permissions for Intune management and joining devices to AAD, but I am unable to complete this via O365 Admin portal or Azure AD.
2. If I create an account in OKTA, I am unable to associate Microsoft Business Premium, Microsoft E3, or Microsoft E5 licensing due to the limitations defined within the profile configuration.  These licenses will be available later this week.



Please advise on how best to adjust accounts appropriately to accommodate a very aggressive initiative timeline.



Thank you for your assistance with this request.



William Herron

_Information Security Manager_

events.body:
William

I found in my research these general steps to accomplish what you are trying to do, if this does not work, I would encourage you to submit a ticket with OKTA support.

If you want to isolate an account in your organization in a way that is no longer governed by Okta, you can follow these general steps:

1. Access the Okta Administrator Dashboard: Log in to your Okta administrator account and access the Okta Admin Dashboard.

2. Locate the user account: Find the user account that you want to isolate and remove from Okta's governance.

3. Disable Single Sign-On (SSO): If the user is currently using Okta for Single Sign-On (SSO), disable SSO for the account. This will prevent the user from accessing Okta-integrated applications using their Okta credentials.

4. Revoke application access: Remove the user's access to any applications that are managed through Okta. This can typically be done within the Okta Admin Dashboard by modifying the user's assigned applications or app assignments.

5. Remove user from Okta groups: If the user is a member of any Okta groups, remove them from those groups. Group membership often determines access rights and permissions within Okta and connected applications.

6. Reset user password: Reset the user's password within Okta to ensure they no longer have access to the Okta account.

7. Monitor and review: Regularly monitor and review the user's activities and permissions to ensure they remain isolated from Okta governance.

It's important to note that the specific steps may vary depending on your organization's Okta configuration and setup. It is recommended to consult Okta's documentation or reach out to their support for detailed guidance tailored to your specific implementation.

![](https://s1g.s3.amazonaws.com/6bd1944f02441844c121a7081c770960.png)


Support Email support@myd4.com
Contact number +1 844-944-6934
Live Support +1 415-444-9900

events.body:
Duane,

I added the previous sender to the safe sender list of the tenant. This is happening with a different or all emails/senders now?

The reason why you are able to see the content it's that you are a global admin according to the following policy:
 ![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/hDolRdYu6XiEzaAXoJXYBeeCc/?name=image.png)

Now to solve this we will create a submission request for Microsoft for these emails so Microsoft starts processing that they are not malware and are not blocked but if they do, they will be classified as malware inside Microsoft services.

Also, I modified a transport rule for this user so he can receive emails and _Skip Safe Attachment Processing,_ please let me know if this is fine. If not we'll need to change the Dynamic Delivery in the previous policy so this does affect other users.

Regards

Camilo
events.html_body:
Duane,
 
I added the previous sender to the safe sender list of the tenant. This is happening with a different or all emails/senders now?
 
The reason why you are able to see the content it's that you are a global admin according to the following policy: 

 
Now to solve this we will create a submission request for Microsoft for these emails so Microsoft starts processing that they are not malware and are not blocked but if they do, they will be classified as malware inside Microsoft services.
 
Also, I modified a transport rule for this user so he can receive emails and Skip Safe Attachment Processing, please let me know if this is fine. If not we'll need to change the Dynamic Delivery in the previous policy so this does affect other users.
 
Regards
 
Camilo

events.body:
Hi Fernando,

I have the final diagnostic, about the issue reported with the laptop assigned to Erick Menendez

Before I took the laptop with me I showed you it had some physical damage and it needed to be checked to investigate a little bit more.

After the inspection to the device I found that it has been dropped and the keyboard and touch pad was damaged, as well it has liquid damage
and food leftover was found in some keys.

As well the screen has a little fissure and it seems to be that someone attempted to fix it putting on it some kind of glue or silicone, the worse part of it was that
there was an attempt to internally open the laptop and the network port was damaged internally.

the laptop is no longer usable, so a laptop replacement was needed.

laptop info:

Laptop info:
Lenovo
Model: E15
Serial number: PF40M418

(Damaged one)

laptop provided:
Lenovo
Model:T450

I will recommend having a talk with the user due to the bad usage of the equipment, as well as a personal feedback TL needs to address the issue with the user for not
reporting things. on Monday we had the issue that he did not remember his credentials and the tools that he uses. It caused a huge delay with IT user did not want to report
the problem with his lead.

I needed to report it to Fernando in order to get assistance with it so he could be able to download his tools and log in to them.

I will be adding Taty and adri to get assistance with the new responsibility later.


kind regards,

william L

![](https://s1g.s3.amazonaws.com/6bd1944f02441844c121a7081c770960.png)


Support Email support@myd4.com
Contact number +1 844-944-6934
Live Support +1 415-444-9900

Hi Fernando,
 
I have the final diagnostic, about the issue reported with the laptop assigned to Erick Menendez 
 
Before I took the laptop with me I showed you it had some physical damage and it needed to be checked to investigate a little bit more.
 
After the inspection to the device I found that it has been dropped and the keyboard and touch pad was damaged, as well it has liquid damage
and food leftover was found in some keys.
 
As well the screen has a little fissure and it seems to be that someone attempted to fix it putting on it some kind of glue or silicone, the worse part of it was that
there was an attempt to internally open the laptop and the network port was damaged internally.
 
the laptop is no longer usable, so a laptop replacement was needed. 
 
laptop info:
 
Laptop info:
Lenovo
Model: E15
Serial number: PF40M418
 
(Damaged one)
 
laptop provided:
Lenovo
Model:T450
 
I will recommend having a talk with the user due to the bad usage of the equipment, as well as a personal feedback TL needs to address the issue with the user for not 
reporting things. on Monday we had the issue that he did not remember his credentials and the tools that he uses. It caused a huge delay with IT user did not want to report
the problem with his lead. 
 
I needed to report it to Fernando in order to get assistance with it so he could be able to download his tools and log in to them.
 
I will be adding Taty and adri to get assistance with the new responsibility later.
 
 
kind regards,
 
william L

events.subject: Check in - ticket (#{{ticket.id}})
events.body:
Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}

I hope all is well! I just wanted to check in and see if you have been able to make any progress with the request in the ticket: (#{{ticket.id}}) 

To maintain consistent service levels for all our clients, we close tickets after seven business days when we await an answer. 

If you want live support from our support team, please call us at 844-944-6934 or reply to this email, and we will contact you.

Good day team,



We have noticed that the number of tickets related to “New Member” has decreased across all clubs.



We are not quite sure if this is happening on specific clubs or only in some like “The Ivy”, “Yellowstone”, etc.



Is there any way that we can check if the link or synchronization between the website and the form the customer fills to become a member and the creation of the New Member ticket in Zoho is correctly configured for all clubs?



Adam showed us some customers that does not have any type of interaction in their profiles since we have never received the New Member ticket to charge the deposit.





Feel free to contact me if you have further questions.







Kind regards,



**Carla Cardona**

Customer Service Team Lead



![Text

Description automatically generated with medium confidence](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/2R4C2u8WewOqUoJyCa4akDVtx/?name=image001.gif)

Email: ccardona@fewinery.com | Direct Line: +1 707 353 5951

Visit us:www.fairwindestatewinery.com
events.html_body:
Good day team,

 

We have noticed that the number of tickets related to “New Member” has decreased across all clubs.

 

We are not quite sure if this is happening on specific clubs or only in some like “The Ivy”, “Yellowstone”, etc.

 

Is there any way that we can check if the link or synchronization between the website and the form the customer fills to become a member and the creation of the New Member ticket in Zoho is correctly configured for all clubs?

 

Adam showed us some customers that does not have any type of interaction in their profiles since we have never received the New Member ticket to charge the deposit.

Carla Cardona

events.body:
Hello Alan,

Thanks for contacting Dimension4!

We've been doing a search about this device NB1049 but it's not showing on intune enrolled devices:

 ![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/lm8eq7XZF3WuYHn7FQAL6voNz/?name=image.png)

We tried calling the user to verify if this computer it's enrolled correctly but we were not able to connect. We did check the devices registered for the user however there is only one Android device. Perhaps the device has a different name or it's not a hybrid device yet?

Could you please help me verify if the device is correctly configured or if it has a local admin user?


 ![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/vrNVExJLvXX84XvqYhmaPdHGa/?name=image.png)

Thank you.

Camilo Zetino
events.html_body:
Hello Alan,
 
Thanks for contacting Dimension4!
 
We've been doing a search about this device NB1049 but it's not showing on intune enrolled devices: 
 

 
We tried calling the user to verify if this computer it's enrolled correctly but we were not able to connect. We did check the devices registered for the user however there is only one Android device. Perhaps the device has a different name or it's not a hybrid device yet?
 
Could you please help me verify if the device is correctly configured or if it has a local admin user?
 
 

 
Thank you.
 
Camilo Zetino

events.body: {"updaterId":"{{current_user.id}}","assignee":"{{ticket.assignee.id}}","priority":"{{ticket.priority}}","ticketId":"{{ticket.id}}","updatedAt":"{{ticket.updated_at_with_timestamp}}","commentCount":"{{ticket.comments.size}}","status":"{{ticket.status}}"}

Hello,



Fran's Old Version local Outlook is not synchronizing with her OWA but the New Version local Outlook is.  The problem is neither the New Version local Outlook nor the OWA accurately reflect her current Old Version local Outlook where she always works.



Last week she toggled the "try new Outlook" button in the upper right of her Old Version local Outlook and it downloaded and opened the "new" version in a separate Window.  She has both of these local apps running on her local machine now and noticed the New Version and OWA are not accurately reflecting what she has done in her Old Version.



She is responding to and moving messages to subfolders in her Old Version local Outlook and has her Inbox trimmed to just 22 messages.



When she views her mailbox online in OWA or in the New Version local Outlook the Inbox contains 436 messages, all the ones that she has read, answered, and moved to subfolders in her Old Version local Outlook are still there.



The app on her phone is also showing the OWA count, not the Old Version local app Inbox.



I have scanned the settings for both the OWA and local apps and I don't see anything unusual.



The problem started about a week ago.



I have attached screenshots for your review.



Thank you,

Terry
events.html_body:
Hello,

Fran's Old Version local Outlook is not synchronizing with her OWA but the New Version local Outlook is.  The problem is neither the New Version local Outlook nor the OWA accurately reflect her current Old Version local Outlook where she always works.  

Last week she toggled the "try new Outlook" button in the upper right of her Old Version local Outlook and it downloaded and opened the "new" version in a separate Window.  She has both of these local apps running on her local machine now and noticed the New Version and OWA are not accurately reflecting what she has done in her Old Version.

She is responding to and moving messages to subfolders in her Old Version local Outlook and has her Inbox trimmed to just 22 messages.

When she views her mailbox online in OWA or in the New Version local Outlook the Inbox contains 436 messages, all the ones that she has read, answered, and moved to subfolders in her Old Version local Outlook are still there. 

The app on her phone is also showing the OWA count, not the Old Version local app Inbox.

I have scanned the settings for both the OWA and local apps and I don't see anything unusual.

The problem started about a week ago.

I have attached screenshots for your review.

Thank you,
Terry
events.plain_body:
Hello, 
 


 
 
Fran's Old Version local Outlook is not synchronizing with her OWA but the New Version local Outlook is.  The problem is neither the New Version local Outlook nor
 the OWA accurately reflect her current Old Version local Outlook where she always works.  

 
 


 
 
Last week she toggled the "try new Outlook" button in the upper right of her Old Version local Outlook and it downloaded and opened the "new" version in a separate Window.  She has both of these local apps running on her local machine now and noticed the New
 Version and OWA are not accurately reflecting what she has done in her Old Version. 
 


 
 
She is responding to and moving messages to subfolders in her Old Version local Outlook and has her Inbox trimmed to just 22 messages.

 
 


 
 
When she views her mailbox online in OWA or in the New Version local Outlook the Inbox contains 436 messages, all the ones that she has read, answered, and moved to subfolders in her Old Version local Outlook are still there.  
 


 
 
The app on her phone is also showing the OWA count, not the Old Version local app Inbox. 
 


 
 
I have scanned the settings for both the OWA and local apps and I don't see anything unusual. 
 


 
 
The problem started about a week ago. 
 


 
 
I have attached screenshots for your review. 
 


 
 
Thank you, 
 
Terry

events.body:
Hi Terry,

This is an early preview of the new Outlook. Not all functionality from the classic Outlook for Windows is migrated entirely in this version yet.

The problem we see is that the two separate Outlook windows are showing at the same time. Normally you are only allowed to use one window at a time, so sync won't be affected. We would like to verify if the old Outlook version is not corrupted. The reason why we consider this is that sync is not happening in the OWA version so I would like to do a remote session with the user and verify the problem itself. We'll try to create a new profile and an online repair to see what is the behavior, but please consider that if we encounter more issues with Outlook versions, we recommend the user to stay in the classic Outlook until they are resolved.

I'm also testing this new version on my end, and we'll try to submit feedback about sync issues with Exchange. At this moment, I'll need the best time to call the affected user.

Regards,

![](https://s1g.s3.amazonaws.com/6bd1944f02441844c121a7081c770960.png)


Support Email support@myd4.com
Contact number +1 844-944-6934
Live Support +1 415-444-9900
events.html_body:
Hi Terry,
 
This is an early preview of the new Outlook. Not all functionality from the classic Outlook for Windows is migrated entirely in this version yet.
 
The problem we see is that the two separate Outlook windows are showing at the same time. Normally you are only allowed to use one window at a time, so sync won't be affected. We would like to verify if the old Outlook version is not corrupted. The reason why we consider this is that sync is not happening in the OWA version so I would like to do a remote session with the user and verify the problem itself. We'll try to create a new profile and an online repair to see what is the behavior, but please consider that if we encounter more issues with Outlook versions, we recommend the user to stay in the classic Outlook until they are resolved.
 
I'm also testing this new version on my end, and we'll try to submit feedback about sync issues with Exchange. At this moment, I'll need the best time to call the affected user.
 
Regards,

Hi Rodrigo,



To answer your questions, no changes have been made to our DNS.  That Autodiscover record was placed there by Microsoft when we set up O365 about 5 years ago.  When I ping that name it resolves to autod.ms-acdc-autod.office.com [52.96.164.136] I get 4 replies.



As for Okta, nothing has changed there either.  It has been in use for over 2 years now.  It may be that Okta doesn't honor the request from your diagnostic tool for security reasons. Let me know if this doesn't help.



Best,

Terry

events.html_body:
Hi Rodrigo, 

To answer your questions, no changes have been made to our DNS.  That Autodiscover record was placed there by Microsoft when we set up O365 about 5 years ago.  When I ping that name it resolves to autod.ms-acdc-autod.office.com [52.96.164.136] I get 4 replies.

As for Okta, nothing has changed there either.  It has been in use for over 2 years now.  It may be that Okta doesn't honor the request from your diagnostic tool for security reasons.  If she can sign into Office using her normal method I would say Okta is working properly.  It would have to provide the token for her to complete the sign in.

Let me know if this doesn't help.

Best,
Terry

Hi Rodrigo,  
 


 
 
To answer your questions, no changes have been made to our DNS.  That Autodiscover record was placed there by Microsoft when we set up O365 about 5 years ago.  When I ping that name it resolves to autod.ms-acdc-autod.office.com [52.96.164.136] I get 4 replies. 
 


 
 
As for Okta, nothing has changed there either.  It has been in use for over 2 years now.  It may be that Okta doesn't honor the request from your diagnostic tool for security reasons.  If she can sign into Office using her normal method I would say Okta is
 working properly.  It would have to provide the token for her to complete the sign in. 
 


 
 
Let me know if this doesn't help. 
 


 
 
Best, 
 
Terry

Hi Francine,

I recently got an update from Microsoft. They explained to me that what we are experiencing on Outlook web and the desktop version is a common behavior and that it is not a sync problem.

I got to know that the count for unread emails will be different for both Outlook client and OWA as this completely depends on how many emails you read from your OWA and Outlook client. There is a difference in how it gets processed between the two. It does not sync the way it syncs your incoming or outgoing emails.

Let me know if you have any concerns about this, and I'll let them know.

Kind regards,

**Rodrigo C.**
 **![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/LpnxJHNIWhKyI1DWdnJZHrMrD/?name=inline-1245591099.png)**

![](https://s1g.s3.amazonaws.com/6bd1944f02441844c121a7081c770960.png)

Live Support +1 415-444-9900
events.html_body:
Hi Francine,
 
I recently got an update from Microsoft. They explained to me that what we are experiencing on Outlook web and the desktop version is a common behavior and that it is not a sync problem.
 
I got to know that the count for unread emails will be different for both Outlook client and OWA as this completely depends on how many emails you read from your OWA and Outlook client. There is a difference in how it gets processed between the two. It does not sync the way it syncs your incoming or outgoing emails.
 
Let me know if you have any concerns about this, and I'll let them know.
 
Kind regards,
 
Rodrigo C.

events.subject: Check in - ticket (#{{ticket.id}})
events.body:
Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}

I hope all is well! I just wanted to check in and see if you have been able to make any progress with the request in the ticket: (#{{ticket.id}}) 

To maintain consistent service levels for all our clients, we close tickets after seven business days when we await an answer. 

If you want live support from our support team, please call us at 844-944-6934 or reply to this email, and we will contact you.

We are having issues with a Wi-Fi camera and app to control the camera.  If the camera and phone are on a hotspot, everything works fine.  If the camera is on our guest or production networks, the application does not connect to the camera.  It looks like there are some ports that are impacting this.



Any help would be appreciated.



Thank you,

**Tony Willis**
Technology Manager
Phone: 317.224.1342
Fax: 317.347.5211

![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/Qz4RlLCW3Y4N8EHXh3oyKPWWQ/?name=unnamed_attachment_1.jpeg)

![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/oFhG3AaQyeTdncu7xWDR28XgQ/?name=unnamed_attachment_2.gif)

* * *

The information contained in this email message is being transmitted to and is intended for the use of only the individual(s) to whom it is addressed.  If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, you are hereby advised that any dissemination, distribution or copying of this message is strictly prohibited.  If you have received this message in error, please delete immediately.

We are having issues with a Wi-Fi camera and app to control the camera.  If the camera and phone are on a hotspot, everything works fine.  If the camera is on our guest or production networks, the application does not connect to the camera.  It looks like there are some ports that are impacting this.

 

Any help would be appreciated.

 

Thank you,

Tony Willis
Technology Manager
Phone: 317.224.1342
Fax: 317.347.5211

events.body:
Hello Tony,

This is a follow-up to continue checking on this request.

We would like to know what are the names of the devices and MAC addresses of the phone and the camera so we can identify in the network. We'll need to check the firewall rules or port restrictions to analyze the behavior.

Also, the camera and phone can connect to the network correctly, but when the camera and phone are trying to connect or "sync", does it stay in a loop of connecting, or does it give an error?

Do you have any specific network that you would like to have these devices in case we need to allow communication between devices?

Please let us know.

Camilo Zetino
events.html_body:
Hello Tony,
 
This is a follow-up to continue checking on this request. 
 
We would like to know what are the names of the devices and MAC addresses of the phone and the camera so we can identify in the network. We'll need to check the firewall rules or port restrictions to analyze the behavior. 
 
Also, the camera and phone can connect to the network correctly, but when the camera and phone are trying to connect or "sync", does it stay in a loop of connecting, or does it give an error?
 
Do you have any specific network that you would like to have these devices in case we need to allow communication between devices?
 
Please let us know.
 
Camilo Zetino

Good afternoon,



Me again! I have another issue to report. Earlier today (12:38 EDT), I received an email from another Gemini employee, Maria Bradley. The problem is that I was not included among the addresses of the email. Here’s the header:



![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/dwX0t4mRnR3aX9MZjFyBv4PyT/?name=image001.png)





I double-checked the outgoing message and confirmed that I was not in the list of addresses (there was no Bcc). I then checked Message Trace and found the message:



![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/KWqSB8oUeBGSnx2tZELFhBbNx/?name=image002.png)



I opened the message in Message Trace:



![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/TyvJ2zNYvT3UwXjHLBAjpmYDS/?name=image005.png)





I then clicked on “Prepare and email extended report”:



![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/EDTXeNUPNV21JjLN58XQmIcqc/?name=image003.png)

![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/LBNimMTi5t4jsF4YWUJ9yfWeL/?name=image004.png)



I submitted the request at 16:47 EDT. After 40 minutes, I received the message below:



**From:** Office365Reports@microsoft.com <Office365Reports@microsoft.com>
**Sent:** Tuesday, April 18, 2023 17:27
**To:** Vince Maconi <vmaconi@gemini-ind.com>
**Subject:** Information regarding your requested Maria Message trace report - ‎2023-04-18T20:46:50.124Z‎





![Office 365](http://image.email.microsoftonline.com/lib/fe95157074600c7e7c/m/1/33337_W15P2_Office365.png)





Dear customer, Your request for Maria Message trace report - ‎2023-04-18T20:46:50.124Z‎ submitted on 4/18/2023 8:47:48 PM has been processed. No data was found that matched the search criteria you specified. Please submit a new request with changed criteria if you expect to obtain valid results.



Thank you,

Microsoft Office 365 Reporting







This message was sent from an unmonitored email address.
Please do not reply to this message. Privacy | Legal

Microsoft Corporation | One Microsoft Way,
Redmond, WA 98052-6399

![Microsoft](http://image.email.microsoftonline.com/lib/fe95157074600c7e7c/m/1/33337_W15P2_Logo_Microsoft.png)







If I am interpreting this message correctly, Microsoft did not find the message that Message Trace had already found and from which I submitted the request for the extended report. That seems to suggest that the message that was not addressed to me, which I did in fact receive, and which I did find using Message Trace, does not actually exist.



Can you help me understand what is happening here? I am very concerned that email messages are being delivered to persons to whom they were not addressed. That would be a MAJOR problem.



Thank you,

Vince
events.html_body:
Good afternoon,

 

Me again! I have another issue to report. Earlier today (12:38 EDT), I received an email from another Gemini employee, Maria Bradley. The problem is that I was not included among the addresses of the email. Here’s the header:

 

 

 

I double-checked the outgoing message and confirmed that I was not in the list of addresses (there was no Bcc). I then checked Message Trace and found the message:

 

 

I opened the message in Message Trace:

 

 

 

I then clicked on “Prepare and email extended report”:

 

 

I submitted the request at 16:47 EDT. After 40 minutes, I received the message below:

 

From: Office365Reports@microsoft.com <Office365Reports@microsoft.com>
Sent: Tuesday, April 18, 2023 17:27
To: Vince Maconi <vmaconi@gemini-ind.com>
Subject: Information regarding your requested Maria Message trace report - ‎2023-04-18T20:46:50.124Z‎

 

 

 

 

Dear customer, Your request for Maria Message trace report - ‎2023-04-18T20:46:50.124Z‎ submitted on 4/18/2023 8:47:48 PM has been processed. No data was found that matched the search criteria you specified. Please submit a new request with changed criteria if you expect to obtain valid results.

 

Thank you,

Microsoft Office 365 Reporting

 

 

 

This message was sent from an unmonitored email address.
Please do not reply to this message. Privacy | Legal

Microsoft Corporation | One Microsoft Way,
Redmond, WA 98052-6399

 

 

 

If I am interpreting this message correctly, Microsoft did not find the message that Message Trace had already found and from which I submitted the request for the extended report. That seems to suggest that the message that was not addressed to me, which I did in fact receive, and which I did find using Message Trace, does not actually exist.

 

Can you help me understand what is happening here? I am very concerned that email messages are being delivered to persons to whom they were not addressed. That would be a MAJOR problem.

 

Thank you,

Vince

Hi team,

events.subject: {{ticket.title}}
events.body:
You are a follower on this request ({{ticket.id}}). {{ticket.follower_reply_type_message}}

{{ticket.comments_formatted}}

Hello Team,



Can you please assist our client with this request



[6:21 AM] Duane W. Mizell

Hello Edwin.



[6:21 AM] Duane W. Mizell

I have another issue -



[6:21 AM] Duane W. Mizell



![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/MuuRtevOjE73bnsUJILwuS5qa/?name=image001.jpg)





[6:21 AM] Duane W. Mizell

I am trying to follow directions to create an access review to automatically remove accounts older than 180 days and I'm getting messages that I need an Azure AD P2 license....



[6:29 AM] Duane W. Mizell

I realize that we don't have 500+ concurrent licenses with Microsoft Office365, and I realize that we're not "the largest firm", but we're spending $50k a year, minimum, on Microsoft services - just through Dimension4. Surely we can work out some kind of an agreement that gives us some better "deal" than having to "fight for" or "request access to" (referencing the Cost Analysis portion here, Azure AD P2 licenses, InTune, MS Defender for Workstations, SCCM licensing... Others...)



There's SO many services that Microsoft offers and I fell like we are kind of just getting the "bare minimum" to get by when we could probably "pay a**little** more" and get access to many, many, more services (like the aforementioned).



[6:30 AM] Duane W. Mizell

Microsoft doesn't have anything to lose by giving us a deal on this stuff - we're forced to use Microsoft, so I'm not sure why we can't identify a mutually beneficial relationship that helps everyone here out.



[7:45 AM] Duane W. Mizell

Edwin, on top of the above conversation, I'd also like to know how I can check how close we have come to our transaction limit(s) for our storage accounts over the past 6 months. I know there are limits based on the size of the storage account for how many transactions we can perform and I'm curious about, specifically, the cool-tiers and what their limits are and how close we've came.

I am trying to follow directions to create an access review to automatically remove accounts older than 180 days and I'm getting messages that I need an Azure AD P2 license....

 

[6:29 AM] Duane W. Mizell

I realize that we don't have 500+ concurrent licenses with Microsoft Office365, and I realize that we're not "the largest firm", but we're spending $50k a year, minimum, on Microsoft services - just through Dimension4. Surely we can work out some kind of an agreement that gives us some better "deal" than having to "fight for" or "request access to" (referencing the Cost Analysis portion here, Azure AD P2 licenses, InTune, MS Defender for Workstations, SCCM licensing... Others...) 

 

There's SO many services that Microsoft offers and I fell like we are kind of just getting the "bare minimum" to get by when we could probably "pay a little more" and get access to many, many, more services (like the aforementioned). 

 

[6:30 AM] Duane W. Mizell

Microsoft doesn't have anything to lose by giving us a deal on this stuff - we're forced to use Microsoft, so I'm not sure why we can't identify a mutually beneficial relationship that helps everyone here out. 

 

[7:45 AM] Duane W. Mizell

Edwin, on top of the above conversation, I'd also like to know how I can check how close we have come to our transaction limit(s) for our storage accounts over the past 6 months. I know there are limits based on the size of the storage account for how many transactions we can perform and I'm curious about, specifically, the cool-tiers and what their limits are and how close we've came.

Hello Duane,

I was doing a review of this and trying to understand it better and appears to be that Microsoft has a default number for transaction requests that can be done per second. Here the azure portal gives the estimated result of all the single read/write operations: See the image below it gives an estimated more than 6 million this month but there is no option to filter what is the top of max transaction that we could have done within the month, remember that is based on the usage for the storage accounts.

 ![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/5CQE599UrVy5ATK1O4SMSVpcs/?name=image.png)



According to Microsoft for this storage account, the requests per second are as follows:


 ![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/tO1KPrfeveqI6eHUgjMLSjH0p/?name=image.png)


This limit applies to the combined read and write operations on the account, as well as to the combined ingress and egress data transfer rates.
Note that this is the default limit and may be increased by requesting a limit increase from Microsoft. However, any increase is subject to approval and may require additional charges.  Please let me know if we are going in the right direction to assist you with this request.

 ![](https://myd4.zendesk.com/attachments/token/7oPVlb8iCHjIQpHhnqc28dhsQ/?name=image.png)

Regards

Camilo
events.html_body:
Hello Duane,
 
I was doing a review of this and trying to understand it better and appears to be that Microsoft has a default number for transaction requests that can be done per second. Here the azure portal gives the estimated result of all the single read/write operations: See the image below it gives an estimated more than 6 million this month but there is no option to filter what is the top of max transaction that we could have done within the month, remember that is based on the usage for the storage accounts.
 

 
 
 
According to Microsoft for this storage account, the requests per second are as follows: 
 
 

 
 
This limit applies to the combined read and write operations on the account, as well as to the combined ingress and egress data transfer rates.
Note that this is the default limit and may be increased by requesting a limit increase from Microsoft. However, any increase is subject to approval and may require additional charges.  Please let me know if we are going in the right direction to assist you with this request.
 

 
Regards
 
Camilo

Hello Duane,

events.body:
Hello Sofia!



To make it clear – other firms that offer the same level of support that you are offering to us provide “insights and cost-savings advice” – free of charge. You guys should know our environment, you already have access, and have helped us build it from the ground up. Everyone is working in Azure right now.



My point in the original request was that REES has paid Microsoft (Specifically Dimension4) $86,333 since January of 2022. On top of this, we’ve purchased An additional ~$5,000 worth of licenses and software via our other vendors (Windows Server CAL’s through CDW, Windows PRO licenses through HP).



There are other firms that we have partnered with, that have explained to us benefits – such as Microsoft including licenses to additional services for FREE. While I understand that these firms are larger than REES, I do not understand how we can spend over $70,000 a year and still be so “low on Microsoft’s totem pole”, that we must beg to get insights into our spending (Cost Analysis section of Azure which we recently JUST got access to), or additional benefits of licenses that are provided to use “free of charge”.



REES would benefit from InTune licensing, Microsoft 365 licensing, and Defender licenses. Can you guys work with Microsoft to either put us on another plan (Open License? MPSA? Partner? – and NO, we are NOT developing apps, but we need a better relationship!) or provide us some additional benefits?





Let me know your thoughts.

Thank you,
**Duane Mizell**
Senior Associate / IT Manager

Hello Duane,

The Open Licenses program has been discontinued since Jan 2022. However, as I mentioned above, we can help you with the Software license purchase. Unfortunately, any transaction you do outside the CSP program with Dimension4 falls out of our scope.

events.body:
Hello Jerry and Brad,

Sorry for the delay in answering back again.

We have tried multiple times to fix the issue; however, we tried many things to resolve this issue.


- Removed the Microsoft Account from Office and added it again.
- I download SARa (Microsoft Tool) to determine any issues. Sara stated that it was a OneDrive problem and that it was not communicating with the correct path.
- I did an Online Repair (It did not work)
- I removed and installed office again.
- I removed the Credentials of Office from Windows Credentials and asked Brad to sign in back again.
- I modified the register key: Go to HKEY_CURRENT_USER > Software > Microsoft >Office > 16.0 >Common > Identity
- I got an error from Event Viewer. Error: Microsoft.AAD.BrokerPlugin_cw5n1h2txyewy. Error Code: -2147024891
- I reset OneDrive from factory settings.

Important: Brad mentioned to me that when he used his laptop without making a remote connection to his desktop. Office works just fine, and he doesn't get any problems.

We discussed this with Brand and agreed to communicate back again on Monday when he is at the office, and we can test the desktop directly.

![](https://s1g.s3.amazonaws.com/6bd1944f02441844c121a7081c770960.png)


Support Email support@myd4.com
Contact number +1 844-944-6934
Live Support +1 415-444-9900
events.html_body:
Hello Jerry and Brad, 
 
Sorry for the delay in answering back again.
 
We have tried multiple times to fix the issue; however, we tried many things to resolve this issue.
 
  • Removed the Microsoft Account from Office and added it again.
  • I download SARa (Microsoft Tool) to determine any issues. Sara stated that it was a OneDrive problem and that it was not communicating with the correct path.
  • I did an Online Repair (It did not work)
  • I removed and installed office again.
  • I removed the Credentials of Office from Windows Credentials and asked Brad to sign in back again.
  • I modified the register key: Go to HKEY_CURRENT_USER > Software > Microsoft >Office > 16.0 >Common > Identity
  • I got an error from Event Viewer. Error: Microsoft.AAD.BrokerPlugin_cw5n1h2txyewy. Error Code: -2147024891
  • I reset OneDrive from factory settings. 
 
Important: Brad mentioned to me that when he used his laptop without making a remote connection to his desktop. Office works just fine, and he doesn't get any problems.
 
We discussed this with Brand and agreed to communicate back again on Monday when he is at the office, and we can test the desktop directly.




 

Support Email support@myd4.com
Contact number +1 844-944-6934
Live Support +1 415-444-9900

Hi Josue,



Thanks for following up.

So this morning I tried to open a file with PowerPoint, and ran into the same problem from before. It was asking me to sign in if I tried opening a file from OneDrive.
But, then I tried opening a blank file and save it to my desktop. After doing that, closing restarting PP and then opening that blank file, the issue resolved itself and I was able to then open files from OneDrive without any inconvenience.
I think I found a work around for the time being then to use Microsoft Office when I need. it.
Let me know if that makes sense or of you have any question.
